text: This obsoletes IRM 1.36.2, Administrative Accounting and Financial Management Reports, Treasury Information Executive Repository.

This IRM is obsolete as the IRM content is contained in the following standard operating procedures, Administrative TIER Submission (IRS Submission) on the following site (S:\IFM\OFR\TIER\SOPS & Position Descriptions\SOPS). The content consists of information and guidance on IRS ﬁnancial data submissions to the Treasury Information Executive Repository (TIER) system. TIER is a database containing records of all month-end Standard General Ledger (SGL) account balances at the attribute detail level for each Treasury Account Symbol. The goal of the TIER program is to ensure the integrity and accuracy of the IRS ﬁnancial data. Financial Reporting is responsible for the Administrative TIER with support from Financial Management Systems.
following responsibilities from IRM 1.36.2, Treasury Information Executive Repository, will be in the next revision of IRM 1.1.21, Chief Financial Officer.

, Chief, Custodial Systems and Headquarters Ac- counting(

) The chief, CSA, is responsible for: a) Maintaining the Redesigned Revenue Accounting Control System (RRACS) and generating extract ﬁles that are consolidated to TIER ﬁle. The RRACS and the CSA staff perform functions that support TIER sub-mission requirements.
, Director, Financial Management Systems(

)The director, FMS, is responsible for: a) Recommending corrective actions for fatal errors that block Administrative TIER submission. b) Maintaining the IFS that generates the TIER extract ﬁle and derivation rules. c) Maintain- ing the underlying IFS and Business Warehouse (BW) TIER ledgers where topside adjust- ments are recorded.
